title: India's Nifty 50, Sensex trim gains; global markets' rally fades
body: Item 1 of 2 A security guard walks past the logo of the National Stock Exchange (NSE) inside its building in Mumbai, India, May 28, 2019. REUTERS/Francis Mascarenhas [1/2] A security guard walks past the logo of the National Stock Exchange (NSE) inside its building in Mumbai, India, May 28, 2019. REUTERS/Francis Mascarenhas Purchase Licensing Rights , opens new tab BENGALURU, Dec 11 (Reuters) - India's blue-chip indexes pared early gains on Monday, as global stocks' rally stalled over doubts about the expected U.S. rate cut in March 2024, ahead of a key U.S. inflation reading and central bank policy decisions. The NSE Nifty 50 index (.NSEI) , opens new tab rose 0.13% to 20,997.10, while the S&P BSE Sensex (.BSESN) , opens new tab settled 0.15% higher at 69,928.53. Get the latest news from India and how it matters to the world with the Reuters India File newsletter. Sign up here. Both indexes gained about 0.3% each during the session, with the Sensex surpassing 70,000 levels for the first time in intraday trade. Reuters Graphics Asian markets declined. The MSCI Asia ex-Japan index (.MIAPJ0000PUS) , opens new tab lost 0.33% on worries about the U.S. rate outlook on the back of stronger-than-expected jobs data and deflationary concerns in China. The U.S. consumer price inflation data and Federal Reserve's rate decision, both due later in the week, are likely to influence the near-term interest rate outlook and market trajectory, two analysts said. Advertisement · Scroll to continue "India represents the single best choice in both Asia ex-Japan and emerging market universes," analysts at Macquarie said in a note, citing strong domestic fund flows, steady earnings and return of foreign fund inflows as key supporting factors for the rally in Indian markets. Pharma stocks (.NIPHARM) , opens new tab fell 0.76%, led by a 5.04% decline in Dr. Reddy's Laboratories (REDY.NS) , opens new tab after its facility in Hyderabad city received observations from the US' drug regulator. The stock was also the top Nifty 50 loser. Advertisement · Scroll to continue Energy (.NIFTYENR) , opens new tab gained 0.40%, supported by the ongoing drop in crude oil prices. Brent Crude futures recorded their seventh consecutive week of losses on Friday, and hovered around $76 per barrel in Asian trading hours. A fall in oil prices is positive for importers of the commodity like India. The more domestically-focussed small- (.NIFSMCP100) , opens new tab and mid-caps (.NIFMDCP100) , opens new tab gained 0.74% and 0.84%, respectively, supported by domestic mutual fund inflows . Reporting by Bharath Rajeswaran in Bengaluru; Editing by Nivedita Bhattacharjee, Dhanya Ann Thoppil and Janane Venkatraman Our Standards: The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles. , opens new tab Share X Facebook Linkedin Email Link Purchase Licensing Rights Read Next 8 mins ago India category India says highly unlikely that UN peace forces will be deployed in Ukraine, Gaza 4 hours ago India category India central bank holds rates, leaves room for December cut 1 hour ago Sustainability category Spooked by AI, Bollywood stars drag Google into fight for 'personality rights' 5 hours ago India category India's September manufacturing growth cools as price rises soar to 12-year high, PMI shows 26 mins ago India category Indian benchmarks snap losing run on cenbank lending boost 4 hours ago India category India set for $8 billion IPO rush in year-end blitz
